title.narrative: F.a: Strengthening the capacity of SNAT to defend trade union rights in Eswatini

description.narrative: The Kingdom of Eswatini is the last absolute monarchy in the world, where political dissent and trade union activity have been very difficult for decades. Despite the challenging operating environment, Eswatini still has active and vocal trade unions and w orkers in most sectors can join unions. However, strikes and other political movements are always suppressed by the security authorities through violence. As a result of the violence, many workers are afraid to join trade unions and many pro-democracy and trade union activists have been deported and are living in exile in South Africa. Teachers are one of the most active professional groups in the Eswatini trade union movement. As a result of the project, teachers of Eswatini and their union SNAT will be a ble to defend their trade union rights more strongly, strengthen their organization and resist pressure on civil society. The project seeks to influence Eswatini's legislation and campaigns for trade union rights in a very difficult operating environment. In addition, SNAT's ability to contribute to social justice and the realization of trade union rights will be increased. The project will also increase teachers' knowledge of their rights and improve SNAT Active's negotiating skills so that they can negoti ate new collective agreements. The project will benefit teachers of Eswatini and their union SNAT. The project is implemented by the Swaziland National Association of Teachers (SNAT) and the Finnish partner is OAJ.
